name: Easy Listening
description: Typically instrumental, including lush arrangements and melodies played by orchestras or big bands aiming for light entertainment.

sub_genres.name: Cocktail Nation
sub_genres.description: Decidedly ironic take on Lounge that emerged in the early 1990s.

sub_genres.name: Exotica
sub_genres.description: Emerged in the early 1950s as the United States developed a fascination with Polynesia and the South Pacific, incorporates traditional instruments and rhythms from these cultures into a Western Pop context.

sub_genres.name: Light Music
sub_genres.description: Instrumental, typically through-composed style performed by an orchestra or small ensemble, with simpler arrangements and an emphasis on strong melodies.

sub_genres.name: Lounge
sub_genres.description: Emerged in the United States during the 1950s, emphasizing a chilled-out atmosphere with light instrumentation and sometimes vocals indebted to Vocal Jazz.

sub_genres.name: Pops Orchestra
sub_genres.description: Orchestra that plays covers of popular songs as well as famous classical compositions.

sub_genres.name: Space Age Pop
sub_genres.description: Inspired by the excitement and optimism of the Space Age during the 1950s and 1960s, frequently experimenting with futuristic sounds made possible by contemporary technology.
